(2011–2012; divorced) |children = 9 |website = {{url|eddiegriffin.com}} }} '''Edward Griffin''' (born July 15, 1968) is an American comedian and actor. He is best known for portraying Eddie Sherman on the sitcom ''[[Malcolm & Eddie]]'' and the title character in the 2002 comedy film ''[[Undercover Brother]]''. He also played Pope Sweet Jesus in ''[[Norbit]]''. ==Early life== Griffin was born in [[Kansas City, Missouri]], and was raised by his single mother, Doris Thomas, a phone company operator.{{cite web|title=Eddie Griffin finds his material in his funky, troubled family|url=http://www.peninsulaclarion.com/stories/040303/ins_0403030006.shtml}} His family were [[Jehovah's Witnesses]].{{cite web|last1=Griffin|first1=Eddie|title=Eddie Griffin on Jehovah Witnesses and the Benefits of Polygamy. Standup Comedy From The Vault|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kx9pp2xZz5A|publisher=The Vault|accessdate=April 7, 2018}} In 1984, at 16 years old, he moved to [[Compton, California]] to live with his cousins. in 1986, after graduating from [[Compton High]], Griffin enrolled as a [[biological engineering]] major at [[Kansas State University]], but later left in 1988 and moved to [[New York City]] to pursue a career in comedy. Griffin did not see his mother for four years, after Griffin and his mother got into an argument at his 20th birthday party, where Griffin's mother accused him of stealing jewelry from her, which Griffin denied doing. Griffin later moved back to [[Los Angeles, California]] in March 1992, to be closer with his family when his mother was injured in a car accident.{{cite web |title =New Material Drives Comedian Eddie Griffin's New Special, Stand-up Tour |url =http://www.recordnet.com/apps/pbcs.dll/article?AID=/20110317/A_ENTERTAIN/103170303/-1/NEWSMAP |accessdate =March 30, 2011}} ==Career== Griffin has starred in films such as ''[[The Meteor Man (film)|The Meteor Man]]'' (1993), The Walking Dead (1995) ''[[Deuce Bigalow: Male Gigolo]]'' (1999), ''[[Double Take (2001 film)|Double Take]]'' (2001), ''[[Undercover Brother]]'' (2002), ''[[John Q]]'' (2002), ''[[Scary Movie 3]]'' (2003), ''[[Deuce Bigalow: European Gigolo]]'' (2005) and ''[[Norbit]]'' (2007). In 2007, he starred in ''[[Urban Justice]]'', a thriller set in [[New Mexico]]. He also starred in the [[UPN]] television series ''[[Malcolm & Eddie]]'' (1996–2000). Griffin was ranked at number 62 on [[Comedy Central]]'s list of the 100 Greatest Stand-ups of All Time.{{IMDb title|0429332|title=Comedy Central Presents: 100 Greatest Stand-Ups of All Time}} In 2011 Comedy Central released [[You Can Tell 'Em I Said It]] on DVD. It was 82 minutes of unedited and uncensored content. Griffin performed on two tracks from [[Dr. Dre]]'s 1999 album, ''[[2001 (Dr. Dre album)|2001]]'', and the intro track from [[The D.O.C.]]'s 1996 album ''[[Helter Skelter (album)|Helter Skelter]]''. He also has appeared on commercials for [[Miller Beer]]'s [[Man Laws]]. He is well known for his comedic routine of imitating [[Michael Jackson]] on [[crack cocaine]]. He also made an appearance on ''[[Chappelle's Show]]'' in the skit "World Series of Dice" as Grits n' Gravy. ==Personal life== Griffin has been married three times. He married his first wife, Carla, in 1984; he was 16 years old.{{cite web |url=http://people.com/archive/verve-griffin-vol-59-no-15/ |title=Verve Griffin |first=Samantha |last=Miller |website=People |date=April 21, 2003 |accessdate=May 7, 2018}} He married his second wife, Rochelle, in 2002, but they have since divorced. On September 8, 2011, he married Nia Rivers.{{cite web|url=http://www.tmz.com/2011/09/12/eddie-griffin-wedding-married-nia-rivers-shawpri-las-vegas-walk-in-sin-city-elope-undercover-brother/?adid=hero3 |title=Eddie Griffin - The Walk-In VEGAS Wedding!!!! |publisher=TMZ.com |date=August 28, 2011 |accessdate=January 29, 2012}} However, they filed for divorce after one month of marriage, citing [[irreconcilable differences]]. They were officially divorced six months later.{{cite web | url=http://www.tmz.com/2012/03/24/eddie-griffin-divorced/ | title=Eddie Griffin FINALLY DIVORCED After 6 Months of Marriage | publisher=TMZ | date=March 24, 2012 | accessdate=October 16, 2014}} In March 2007,{{cite news|url=http://www.cbsnews.com/stories/2007/03/27/entertainment/main2611916.shtml | work=CBS News | title=Eddie Griffin Wrecks $1.5 Million Ferrari | date=March 27, 2007}} Griffin participated in a charity race at [[Irwindale Speedway]] to promote the film ''Redline'', using a [[Ferrari Enzo]] owned by Daniel Sadek. During a practice run, Griffin accidentally hit the gas pedal instead of the brake and lost control of the Enzo, crashing hard into a concrete barrier. He walked away unscratched, but the $1.5 million supercar was badly damaged. Griffin later criticized reporters who suggested the crash was a publicity stunt.{{cite web |url=http://people.com/celebrity/eddie-griffin-car-wreck-injuries-no-hoax/ |title=Eddie Griffin: Car Wreck, Injuries No Hoax |website=People.com |first1=Pete |last1=Norman |first2=Kimberly |last2=Pfeiffer |date=March 30, 2007 |accessdate=April 27, 2018}} During the [[Bill Cosby sexual assault allegations|sexual assault allegations]] on [[Bill Cosby]], Griffin suggested that Cosby was the victim of a conspiracy to destroy his image and that several other prominent African-American men had been victims of similar conspiracies.{{Citation |last=Howard |first=Adam|date=December 31, 2015 |title= Eddie Griffin defends Cosby, alleges 'systematic effort to destroy' black male stars |publisher=MSNBC |url=http://www.msnbc.com/msnbc/comedian-eddie-griffin-defends-cosby-sites-systematic-effort-destroy-black-male-entertainers |accessdate=December 31, 2015 }} ==Filmography== ===Film=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !
